Reviews.Title: “Stay only if desperate...”
Reviews.Author: SneakyTravelKitty
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed at, although location cannot be beat. 5 minute walk to Centraal train station, shops, coffee shops and Red Light district. Stayed here March 31st - April 2nd with a friend, still cannot believe we paid almost $200 Euros/2 nights for this dungeon. The stench of weed is everywhere in this "non-smoking" hotel. Rooms are tiny, dirty and dark, so are the beds and the bathroom. From my window I had a view of the hotel wall and 5-6 other hotel windows to other rooms. Privacy and silence is unheard of here - close your blinds and get a pair of good earplugs if you are planning to get some rest, rooms are noisy all day and night. People throw stuff from windows, so pigeons are all over the place. NO ELEVATOR here!! - I had to drag my 25kg suitcase up and down the tiny staircases. NO free WIFI either. I gotta give the credit to the blonde front desk guy - he was helpful and cheerful dealing with all that crap, I guess he's is used to it. Pay more and stay away from here!!!

Reviews.Title: “pay extra for elswhere”
Reviews.Author: luvlylynzi
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights , rooms are small, scruffy & very basic but in an ideal location (near train station & the grass hopper) the stairs are like most places in amsterdam very steep, the card machine didnt work when we got there so had to go and find cash machine to pay for reservation (staff wouldnt let me get changed in the room even though i was soaked) but at least we had our own bathroom which had a good shower and hot water

Reviews.Title: “Budget very budget”
Reviews.Author: TonySopranosVest
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a bunch of friends and it's very definitely a budget style place. The only positive is the location. The rooms are tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but more hostel then hotel quality”
Reviews.Author: ciarammcn
Reviews.Content: I have to admit when I first arrived here I was not impressed. Hotel is definately too good a description, it really was more like a hostel. The decor was awful and the reception area really was more like a waiting room at a train station reception then a hotel reception. There was no lift either and the stairs were really steep and narrow and there was no amentities (for example bar/restaurant). There was no breakfast service. Lugging heavy suitcase up those stairs was great exercise! However, the staff were extremely helpful. In fact they were so helpful that after a day I had pretty much forgotten my initial disappointment, they really were very nice and on our last day they even minded our bags for us after we checked out so we could enjoy the last day of our holiday without lugging heavy suitcases with us. Also the location was unbeatable. It really is in the very centre of Amsterdam and within walking distance of everything. Anything not within walking distance is easily accessible on the hop on/hop on city bus tour. Only thing I would say is the windows were quite big and if opened would be very easy to fall out of (a lot of people go to coffee shops in Amsterdam and might lean out the window to get some air etc and could easily fall) There was only a small bar across the window

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, free insect bites with each stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lukeo88
Reviews.Content: I stayed with three other people, it was my idea to go down the cheap road and pay Â£20 each to stay at this hotel. Hotel staff where great, no problems, one person travelling with us sprained her leg spot was hard for her to get up the stairs, but anyone who hasn't done their research will not know that Amsterdam is know for steep stairs! The room we where given was good, looked clean. I woke up the next day to an itch on my face, leg and bum, something had bit me! Never the less I soldiered on. Now I'm back home over a week since I got bitten, the bites had swelled up and causing a lot of pain, first problem one was on the face, that's swelled down but the one on my bum is so painful and won't go away, beleive it or not I'm leaning on my right side of my bum as its comfy. So be aware!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: AlexDenny
Reviews.Content: Went to stay in amsterdam for a short break, visit the red light and some coffee shops ect. The hotel is right by everywhere really. Right in the centre , about 5 mins walk from the station. Staff are friendly and even let us leave our bags after we have checked out. We would stay here again. If you want somewhere cheap to stay that is clean and convenient stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain room - great location - Be Careful of the stairs!”
Reviews.Author: NTF07
Reviews.Content: Cheap place, rooms are what you'd expect for a cheap room. We had a room for 6 on the 2nd floor. Bathroom really small , bit cramped but what more do you want for 54Euro for 2 nights ! Literally 100 yards away from The Grass Hopper pub/club which is the place to be :o) The staff were lovely, let us keep our bags in the holding room as we had a late flight. Be very careful of the stairs as they are very very steep and if you've had a few to many cakes/beers they are very dangerous!

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot,clean and lovely”
Reviews.Author: simpletravelerka
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Ben twice (recently 3-4 Oct)and it's a perfect place. I would reccomend it probably to young people or backpackers who do not need luxury, but a clean,safe,friendly place to stay. Perfect location, perfect price, spotless bathroom, very clean room,although basic, but that's reflected in the price. Very comfy beds:]Bit noisy so get ear plugs if you are a light sleeper.Yes stairs are steep but you can expect that in this type of buildings. Lovely staff and please read the room and hotel description on the site as it is genuine. If you are fussy about smoking policy, noise, breakfast or you want to stay with family(children) I'd advise something else.Cash only, so be prepared.You can leave your luggage after check out, which is really great help. I hope I can stay here every time I visit Amsterdam, I absolutely love the place and would like to thank all the staff for their hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Mind the stairs..........”
Reviews.Author: frazzamacca
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a reasonably priced hotel, in the middle of Amsterdam, and arent bothered about the frills, you cant beat the Ben. Its 5 minutes walk from the station, on the edge of the red light district 50 yds from The Grasshopper bar. However, if you drink as much as we did, the stairs back to your room will become precarious. We were on the fourth floor, felt like the fourty fourth due to amount of Amstel drunk on a lads weekend which took in World Superbike racing at Assen racetrack. Its not fancy and I wouldnt take the wife there but its location is fantastic, staff are good and its clean and tidy. Probably go again next year and will ask for a lower floor. One thing, you may need to take cash. For some reason they wouldnt accept a credit card as a means of payment although they took one as a deposit when booking. Check when you book.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Britney C
Reviews.Content: I went last May for a Friends 21st birthday with 8 VERY HIGH MAINTANCE girls who managed to stay here and have a good time. Its not the nicest place in the world but its basic and ok. When your only going for the weekend you spend little time in there anyway. There is alot of stairs to get to the room and its abit like a maze, but u can get rooms from 2 - 6 people so its good for a large group. The people are nice, they moan if your to loud but they are ok. Its in a very good location, 2min walk from Grasshoopers one of the best cafes, 5mins from the high room and maybe 10mins max to the heart of the red light. Food is super expensive around it so bring munchies with you like sweets and stuff because there isnt much of that. Not to great but get what you pay for and id defo go back again. Also extra bonus you can smoke in your room nowhere else allows this.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: robbie2011Askersund
Reviews.Content: Dont stay here! This was the badest hotel we have ever sleeped in! Rude personal, no parking for our car in the neighbourhood ( we had to go 20 min to a parking house and then take the metro back to the hotel, parking costs eur 5 per hour in the centre of Amsterdam). Find a hotel outside the centre instead. A VERY narrow and steep stairs up to the second floor, our room was tilting A LOT so you could only sleep in one direction. A very dirty floor, no breakfast. The only good thing was the location and the price! 4 beds 105 euro. Then the staff came and opened our door 09.30 and told us that we had to be gone before 11.30. It was and experience to see this kind of BAD hotel!

Reviews.Title: “where do i start???”
Reviews.Author: dieg00
Reviews.Content: after reading all the bad reviews about this place i was so surprised when i got there!! i went with three of the girls and we all just wanted a place to put our heads.... we got in reception was grand, clean and relaxed. there was loads of stairs really narrow and crooked!! but the rooms where clean, had a small tv, a window that opens... (and you could smoke) !! the room was crooked so that was a bit weird!! bath room was ok clean... shower was clean but kept going hot and cold!!! really relaxed place to stay in... would reccomend it to anyone whos young and just there for a few days!

Reviews.Title: “Please do not stay here! Dangerous and filthy!”
Reviews.Author: val444
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed somewhere as horrific as this before. And i wouldn't be too high maintenance. We knew that the price and location were an indication of a poor quality hotel, but this was something else entirely. The place is disgusting. The people in reception were unpleasant, the stairs is as steep as in the Anne frank house, and there are cat doors everywhere to allow the mangy cat free access to all parts of the hotel. The room itself was the dirtiest i have ever seen, a tiny bed, carpet crawling with dirt, and no air unless you opened the window, which would then give any maniac the opportunity to climb in. We checked out after just one night on the incredibly uncomfortable mattresses and mentioned our unhappiness to the staff who instead of offering any kind of an apology, told us what we were saying was "bulls**t".

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay”
Reviews.Author: robions
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Got to the hotel too early to check in. So left bags with man behind counter. When returned couple hours later bags were in exact same position with nobody looking after them from reception anyone could have walked in and grabbed them. We were given a key for room 227 top floor nightmare. Walked in to the all I could smell was sick, it made me want to go home. But decided to go get some cleaning products to clean all the very suspicious stains (blood,excrement, god knows what else). After room was clean the smell of sick still lingered so had to have the window open the whole time we were there. Even on the day of leaving it still smelt of sick, or something had died in there. The carpet was disgusting didn't even take shoes off. On the plus side the bathroom was fairly clean. The price is cheap so wasn't expecting anything great but better than what was waiting for us. Don't stay here at all costs or you will be disappointed or cleaning the room like us.

Reviews.Title: “Not exciting but very acceptable!”
Reviews.Author: IAmCrockit
Reviews.Content: the location is perfect, literally 1 street away from the red light district but on a street which also has a large church therefore pleasantly quiet. on a boring uneventful street in the city centre, seconds walk to sex shops, coffee shops and a canal. check area has vending machines. remote needed a â‚¬10 deposit. we had a quad room, had no bedside lockers and was a little small but perfectly comfortable, clean and acceptable (and im fussy!) we were told we could smoke in the rooms but had to sit next to window which we never did, we panned out n bed and never set off any alarms. had an ensuite - small/pokey but at least it was clean! the 4 of us had 1 room key which we were never allowed to take out of building. we had to leave it at reception when we arrived and used little business type room cards we displayed to get back in any time. the stairs are steep and theres loads of them, they are steep and theres lots of them lol dont recall ever seeing any other guests even though the building had many rooms. you get what you pay for. its cheap, very cheap but surprisingly secure, clean and enjoyable! can be walked to from central station in less than 10minutes and easily found.

Reviews.Title: “For young red light district revellers who want basic, cheap and secure accommodation.”
Reviews.Author: jpsmyth
Reviews.Content: Hotel Ben is aimed at young travellers/ revellers (mainly groups of lads) for the red light district who want basic, cheap, secure and private accommodation, something more than a hostel but at a similar price and are going to use the hotel as a base during the late hours, not staying there for anything in particular but a nap. If youâ€™re not in Amsterdam for this then youâ€™ll be hugely disappointed. Externally the hotel looks very commercial and Iâ€™m sorry to say this cheap so it does fit into the red light district area. The reception area is simple with just the desk, Red Bull drink machines, a pamphlet stand and a few chairs. The resident cat thatâ€™s always milling around the reception must be the owners and adds an element of quirkiness you donâ€™t get from other hotels in such a built up area. Rooms are accessible over several floors from the main steep stairs you get in many traditional narrow Amsterdam properties (if you cannot climb many steep stairs this hotel is not for you). Smaller corridors lead off from the main stairs to rooms. The rooms at Hotel Ben are without a doubt the most basic of rooms Iâ€™ve ever stayed in (almost prison cell like); they are small, narrow but long and feature cheap beds (thin mattresses), blankets (no duvets!), plain dÃ©cor, an open wardrobe (well itâ€™s a box really), 14â€� box colour television, small round table, stools and an en-suite with very hot water. The floors are uneven and in the middle of summer very very very hot and sweaty (no air conditioning), after the first night we had to buy fans to cool ourselves off, even then it didnâ€™t do the trick. The location of the hotel right in the heart of the red light district (and I mean right in the heart with bars and sex shops outside the bedroom window bellow) this means that between 6pm â€“ 3am sound levels of drunken people outside on the street bellow resonate throughout the hotel and unless youâ€™re drunk or very tired, it does take a while to get some sleep. In general the hotel caters especially for the budget traveller and people on a red light district trip. It is not suitable for any other age or type of guest, especially children based upon its location. The location is right in the middle of the centre so at no distance to bars, clubs, restaurants and museums, whilst guests are required to hand their key in exchange for a card saying they are staying at the hotel when you leave for the day (so guests donâ€™t lose keys). I wonâ€™t be staying here again as I would pay more for a hotel with better facilities that is a little quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay, nothing exciting but you pay what you get”
Reviews.Author: jawray25
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in fanstatic location, near the pubs, cafes, restaurants, shops and not too far from other attactions too. Approx 5-10 min walk from Central Station. Rooms were basic and clean (to an extent) however a bit of damp on the ceiling and smelt a bit musty. Decor is poor. Main complaint was that the walls were so thin and you could hear everything from the room next door, 5 lads high on pot (or whatever else they had) doing kung foo kicks during the night (funny at first but not a few hours later), also our room was situated at the back of the hotel which backs onto the main street which became very noisy at night. It is ok if your staying out until the early hours but on the last night we had to go to sleep earlier because of early flight and the noise was too loud. I have now stayed at a 1star hotel, cheap and pay for what you get but don't think I would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Sucks - Stay Anywhere Else”
Reviews.Author: julieeandrews
Reviews.Content: OK, so from the photos and website we knew what we were getting ourselves in for when we booked this hotel. We actually used bookings.com instead of Expedia this time but had great service from them too. The hotel is right in the centre of town which is great and we had a friendly man at check-in. When we actually got to the room though on the second floor we decided to check back out. The room stank of cigarette smoke and was right over an alley way. The bed was made with clean sheets and looked fine but there was blood/ faeces smeared on the wall ( we argued over what it might be). The stairs are a health hazard, steep and in need of repair. There are no fire extinguishers on any of the floors, just old fire hoses. Given the fact that most of the people staying there are smokers, it's of some concern. If you're here to smoked copious amounts of weed and are 20 years old with no $$ it's probably OK but really walk around and find something else.

Reviews.Title: “Central location...basic but clean,”
Reviews.Author: MarkUK87
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here once, the room was fairly small 3 beds crammed in to the room with little room for much else, but that's all we needed. For the price it's good, bang in the centre of everything and a parrot is there to welcome you on check in. Only 10 minutes(maybe even less) walk from Central Station, taxi rank is one minute walk away, less than five minute walk to the red light district and countless coffeeshops around it. One word of caution though, the Church bells are pretty loud in the morning, but it's bearable and actually got us out of the hotel before 10am every morning.

Reviews.Title: “hotel ben, it is what you think, so what!”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireBob1978
Reviews.Content: we payed just over Â£100 for 3 nights so wernt expecting anything, in fact slightly concerned. most of the reviews are spot on, steep stairs, rubbish shower ect, ect, but for the absolutley amazing location and the cheap price i would recomend it to anyone whoe's going to the dam for a good time and just need a place to crash or a base. for my stag weekend it was perfect, dont rekon i would take the mrs there for romantic weekend though!

Reviews.Title: “Take care at Hotel Ben”
Reviews.Author: Antequerana
Reviews.Content: This hotel, while well situated close to Central Station, is grubby and poorly managed. In particular I warn other travellers not to book via the hotel's online facility, which is very slow. I unfortunately attempted to book using it, and thinking I had failed, booked again via Hoteliers.com. When I arrived at the hotel, the receptionist told me I had double booked, and checked that it was an error. I was surprised they hadn't bothered to email me, but I confirmed that it was a mistake, and they promptly let the extra room to the people behind me in the queue. However, I was still charged for an additional night. I find this attitude disgraceful, and would not recommend the hotel because of its poor customer service. However, after spending a weekend in a small, hot room, with a TV you cannot use unless you pay 50 euros for a remote control, there is really nothing positive to say about Hotel Ben.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: cole271189
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel with a few friends on a mad weekend in amsterdam :) the hotel was not amazing, however the rooms were clean and our room was quite big.. the hotel is in a perfect spot and has many places nearby to eat, shop and smoke of course! you can also smoke in your room if you open the window which was handy as those stairs were way to steep to go outside everytime you wanted a smoke..overall the hotel did its job, we only needed it to sleep and wash!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but great for the price”
Reviews.Author: EvoWales
Reviews.Content: Wasn't quite sure what to expect as it was so cheap but ideal for a few days. Close to the train station and the main sites no need for taxis or trams. The room I had was very basic but did have shower & WC en-suite (rare in budget hotels in Amsterdam). A clean room, rather basic but as a place to crash ideal. There's no chamber maid so staying for more than a few days is probably not a good idea. Staff were friendly and helpful (the cat and the parrot are a fun little feature too)! lol Good security at the hotel access is only for those staying.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DaveG40
Reviews.Content: Myself and My Partner flew out to Amsterdam recently with no hotel booked, we know the city so finding a hotel wasn't going to be hard... After a quick stop in the grasshopper, we strolled 200 yards down the road to Hotel Ben and booked a double room for â‚¬60 per night, within budget and with a seperate shower and toilet in the rooms which I was offered to inspect prior to payment meant we'd found a place to stay quickly and easily very close to the centraal station! The Reception staff were very helpful and friendly, citytax was included and the sheets were clean as was the room. we had a back room over looking the small courtyard which meant noise was kept to a minimum at night, over all no worse than sleeping in any other city in terms of noise, with only the bells sounding but even they were easily phased out after the first sleep. I'd re-visit hotel ben, short stays here are ideal but any longer than 3-4days and i would consider a hotel that would allow guests into the rooms as we had friends staying a bit further out and it would have been nice to have relaxed with them in the room at times rather than spending money sat in bars / coffeeshops. You can smoke in the rooms, and keys can be left with reception when out for the day to avoid hassle of losing the key. Overall i'd give the hotel 8/10, aircon could be added, better beds, and newer fittings could easily increase the hotel from one star to 2 or above. Thanks Hotel Ben

Reviews.Title: “Its Fine for a few nights. Loved the location, hate the stairs.”
Reviews.Author: submethod
Reviews.Content: Hi gang, Well i just returned from Amsterdam with ym girlfriend. We both stayed at Hotel Ben. Overall, this place is conveniently located in the center of everything. We had a cool view of the Church and it would sound alot in the mornings and evening. It was charming. The rooms are clean. The management very helpful and kind. Overall a good spot to sleep for a couple of days. The hotel has alot of pot smokers in it. YOu can catch a whiff any time of day. Moreover, the walls are thin so be prepared to hear people go about there business late, late at night. The stairs are perhaps the worst I have ever encountered. I have been to amsterdam a few times and understand that the hotels are small. However, this was out of hand. Please see my photos! If you have heart problems or are not physically fit, do not stay at this hotel. The stairs will kill you. LOL Overall, I would stay here again but for a brief (2day visit). IF you want class, you gotta hit another hotel. Do not get me wrong. It is like staying a Motel 6 without a TV. BTW, they have a cat and parrot in the lobby that are hilarious to kick it with. :)

Reviews.Title: “ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: dickie_blue_eyes
Reviews.Content: Only needed somewhere to sleep for 1 night, in fact we only spent 6 hours in the room. For the money we paid the hotel was fine, we knew what to expect and got just that. No frills hotel, friendly staff, room was small but it had en suite shower and toilet but there were only small hand towels available so take your own bath towels. Be warned the stairs are very VERY steep, we were on the top floor and it was hard work especially at 3am! The location of the place was perfect, very short walk from central station and RLD and plenty or bars. Overall, this place is fine for lads (or girls) who just want somewhere cheap to stay while they're on a weekend away, just dont expect too much from it remeber you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to put your head for the night”
Reviews.Author: karen__209
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Amsterdam with nowhere booked and as the whole City was booked out because of some Chinese conference, we were glad to get anywhere at all.. And anywhere is better than the street, especially in Amsterdam! This place is not too bad.. front desk staff are friendly... and a little too friendly maintenance man... strange to say the least (i.e poking his head in the bedroom door at 9am when im half naked and still in bed ,strange!!.. he also followed us to a bar one night!) The first room we had was a quad room; 4 matresses on wooden slats and some itchy wooly cover blankets.. bed sheets laundry style clean and some free toiletries.. but if you dont like to wash your hair in Wash Up Liquid then i dont recommend using these!! The beds were tiny, only about 4.5 foot long and just wide enough to squeeze myself into... We were given a double room for the further 4 nights there, which consisted of one double bed, again on a wooden slat... The bathroom was up a small stairway within the room (you dont want to be climbing this when drunk) ... In general the room was very dark and had one window which overlooked .. well nothing really, directly infront of us was another window to another room (Friendly neighbours though!!) There was a family of Pigeons living outside the window also,and they made almost as much noise as our rowdy British Male neighbours... Not for the faint hearted or those expecting any kind of luxury or frill..or those with breathing difficulties!! The stairs are a killer.. almost vertical! All in all its a tiny step up from a hostel.. we paid 250 euro each for 5 nights...so not tremendously cheap but i think they took advantage of the very busy weekend in Amsterdam.. Despite the lodgings, Amsterdam is a great place.. Ive been a few times.. Ive stayed in a Citymundo Apartment before and had a very pleasant time..(also stayed in Victoria Hotel..nice but not fantastic) If you are broke or stuck, pick Hotel Ben for somewhere relatively safe to sleep(in the Red Light Area) and at least there are 4 walls around you and a locked door to keep the Maintenance Man out!!!!! When I got home, I had some strange looking red marks all down one side of my body.. If i was pushed to try to explain what they were, I wouldnt be too far wrong to suggest flea bites.......
